data.title: GridMap does not support navigation meshes.
data.body:
Currently, a GridMap's MeshLibrary can have the following date for each of its tiles:
1) The Mesh itself, which is to be rendered
2) The collision shape for the mesh, to be used for people to bump into and walk on.

![meshlib_editing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3822768/13930171/6dcdfbe6-efa6-11e5-872f-273dcd2014df.png)

My problem is that i want to use a GridMap for generating a 3d maze, which should be navigated by game characters. That is not possible, because upon conversion of a Scene into a MeshLib, navmeshes for each tile are lost.

I think being able to navigate gridmap mazes is a pretty important thing to have for gridmaps as long as they exist at all, so it would be very nice to be able to attach navigation data to meshlib tiles.

Here's an example of an unfortunate situation where the GridMap simply stops sufficing, in the form of a modified navmesh demo.

![godot_mergemesh](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3822768/13930220/c5e22cda-efa6-11e5-9625-03db8b24b52d.png)
[navmesh-vs-gridmap.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/182903/navmesh-vs-gridmap.zip)

data.title: Syntax highlighting for numbers
data.body: Added syntax highlighting for numbers.

data.title: Array() is not shared and causes various issues
data.body:
I found a bug with arrays / dictionaries. Consider this code example:

```
var a = []
a.push_back( { dictionaryValue = 2 } )
print ( "a.size: ", a.size() )
# prints a.size: 1

var b = Array()
b.push_back( { dictionaryValue = 2 } )
print ( "b.size: ", b.size() )
# prints b.size: 1

var x = { items = [] }
x.items.push_back( { dictionaryValue = 2 } )
print ( "x.items.size: ", x.items.size() )
# prints x.size: 1

var y = { items = Array() }
y.items.push_back( { dictionaryValue = 2 } )
print ( "y.items.size: ", y.items.size() )
# prints y.size: 0
```

y.items.size should also be 1

data.title: Make Array.pop_front and Array.pop_back return popped value
data.body:
Please make `Array.pop_front` and `Array.pop_back` return popped value.

`pop` returning the value is standard among just about every language I've ever encountered.

data.title: unwanted offset added to non-square tiles in tilemap
data.body:
Before using 2.0 stable, GodotEngine displays tiles like this:

![original](https://s11.postimg.org/ukt11jycj/tiles.png)

(the top one is the original tile, and the bottom one is horizontally flipped in the tilemap. The origin point is actually in the first tile rather than the middle one, but it is centered as expected anyways.)

In the stable version, it looks like this:

![stable](https://s28.postimg.org/vj05uzu3h/tiles2.png)

For some reason, an extra offset is automatically added onto the beginning of the tiles.

data.title: Rename 'default_density' to 'default_linear_damp' in project settings
data.body:
What 'default_density' in project settings actually sets is AREA_PARAM_LINEAR_DAMP. There's already a 'default_angular_damp' setting and this property seems to be mostly referred to as linear damp in the editor and docs, so to avoid confusion I suggest being consistent with the naming.

This change will affect older projects that use 'default_density', but the switch should be very simple.

[Test project](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/181423/godot-test-default-linear-damp.zip)

data.title: Had to download 150MB every upgrade on Steam
data.body:
Because Godot use upx ( which is discouraged by Steam, because they use their own compression ) after every upgrade most of binary is changed and Steam had do redownload it whole ( normally Steam breaks your game files into 1MB chunks and redownload only those chunks that were changed ).

Problem is, that without upx'ing Godot templates games produced by Steam Godot will few MB larger...

Possible solustions with their downsides:
1. Package Godot with upx and compress templates on host - may have problem with upx license, may produce longer installation time/longer package time for games ( if we decide to use upx on templates on game package and give Developer option to use upx or not use upx - this may be good idea ).
2. Have templates as separate DLC.
3. ...?

**Personally I like the idea where game developer can decide if his game should be upx'ed or not.**

data.title: Last tab gets hidden on update when many tabs are opened
data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

When you have many tabs opened, they can't all be displayed so there are two arrows to browse through the open tabs. When you browse all the way to the right to see the last tab, and click on any tab to change the focus (including the last tab), this last tab will be hidden. See e.g.:

![spectacle d30156](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/13904533/51a57596-eea4-11e5-9389-c6bedcce57d2.png)

![spectacle b30156](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/13904529/36c0d1e4-eea4-11e5-9802-39801d4957c7.png)

In the above screenshots alpha_Level_011.tscn is the last opened tab, but clicking any tab will hide it (screenshot 2) even if it had been made visible previously (screenshot 1).

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Open many tabs so that there are more tabs than can fit in the UI
- Browse all the way to the right to see the last tab
- Click on any tab, the last tab will be hidden

data.title: Expose android/shutdown_adb_on_exit parameter
data.body:
It was added in 30d0ca9 for the Steam build but only enabled
when parsing a ._sc_ file that would define it.
It is now available for all users to toggle, in and outside of Steam.

Fixes #4073.

data.title: Add support for gnu-libstc++-4.9 needed by recent NDK versions
data.body:
for this to work properly you need to also export these environmental variables

``` bash
export NDK_TARGET="arm-linux-androideabi-4.9"
export the NDK_TARGET_X86="x86-4.9"
```

along with the

``` bash
ANDROID_HOME
ANDROID_NDK_TARGET
```

remove gabi++ and replaced with the new gnu-libstdc++

data.title: Show contents of dictionary type during GDScript debugging
data.body: I use the built in debugger and dictionaries a lot in the editor. It'd save a lot of time if we were able to peek into the dictionary type while inside the debugger in order to see the contents of the dictionary.

data.title: Dynamic property list for control margins
data.body: This PR makes the margin properties of a control dynamic, specifically switching between using floating points and integers depending on whether ratio anchors are being used. This makes ratio anchors actually useful when editing guis from the editor, whereas they would originally only be useful when generated via code.

data.title: Added New Listener Spatial Node.
data.body: I added a new object which can override the position of the SoundServer 3D listener. Originally, the position of the listener could only be controlled by the presence of a 3D camera; this still functions the same and cameras can control the listener position, but the new listener node will take priority if active. Can be useful for situations where you might, for example, want 3D sound to be relative to the position of a character rather than the camera, and would be especially useful for any future multi-camera support.

data.title: After saving a scene, popup nodes become invisible in other open scenes
data.body: To reproduce, create a new scene and add some nodes that inherit Popup. Now make another new scene and save it. If you go back to the scene with the popups, they should be invisible now.

data.title: Cannot click meshes in instanced scenes when they are under a spatial node
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Arch Linux

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Meshes in instanced scenes cannot be click-selected when they are beneath a spatial node.  This is especially problematic because Godot's blender/collada export/import results in imported meshes being beneath a spatial node.

I would expect to be able to click instanced objects to select them.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a new scene with a spatial node at the root (Scene 1)
2. Create another scene with a spatial node at the root (Scene 2)
3. Add a mesh beneath "Scene 2"
4. Create an instance of "Scene2" within "Scene 1"
5. Try to select the instanced scene by clicking on the mesh

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[UnclickableInstance.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/180969/UnclickableInstance.zip)

data.title: Can't drag child nodes if base node of scene is a Popup node
data.body:
in version 2.01stable 64bit windows10

If you make the base node of a scene a Popup node, it seems that you can't drag it's child nodes with your mouse. You can still change the size of the node with the mouse, but you can't change its position. You can also still change the child nodes' positions by editing their values. This only happens if the popup node is the base node of the scene, so if it were a child of a node you could still drag its children normally.

To reproduce, create a new scene and make the base node a Popup node. Then make any kind of child node and see if you can change its position by mouse.

data.title: Ability to change user data path in Project Settings
data.body:
I think it makes sense to be able to change the user data path (where `user://` points to) in the Project Settings, ideally per-OS.

Something like:
- Windows User Data Path
- Linux User Data Path
- OS X User Data Path
- Android User Data Path

data.title: MarginContainer improvements
data.body:
What is introduced by this PR:
- Extra margins: top, right and bottom. The custom constant _margin_ has been replaced by _margin_left_, _margin_top_, _margin_right_ and _margin_bottom_ (only for _MarginContainer_). All margins except _margin_left_ are set to _0_ by default, to avoid breaking compatibility with the editor.

I am adding the _discussion_ label, since I am not sure if this may be against the original purpose of _MarginContainer_.

data.title: BoxContainer: Bind method add_spacer(bool)
data.body: :point_up: :point_up: :point_up:

data.title: TextEdit: Fix Shift+Delete shortcut not calling cut()
data.body:
_Shift+Delete_ (introduced by #4062) was not working in _TextEdit_.

Closes #4060 again :P

data.title: Fixes #3942 - Throws an error when exporting for X11 with no filename
data.body: Error was only when exporting for Linux/X11, other platforms were managed by the filter, while checking for the file extension.

data.title: Cannot find binary from 'scons platform=x11' Linux build
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Debian 8 / SteamOS

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I can build the project just fine, but the binary does not go in bin/. If I add the tools flag, I do see a binary (godot.x11.tools.64).[Here is my [debian](https://github.com/ProfessorKaos64/LibreGeek-Packaging/tree/brewmaster/godot/debian) folder. I am use pbuilder and `scons platform=x11` to test a build.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Clone repo
2. enter repo
3. Get dependencies via apt-get
4. run `scons platform=x11`
5. bin/ only contains SCsub (ascii file) and tests/ folder.

Is this a matter of missing a simple scons flag?

data.title: Fix issues with tilemap covering child nodes and old quadrants
data.body:
Closes #4070 

The fix is as following:
1. Even when redrawing a quadrant, we would still reorder all quadrants.
2. All child CanvasItems are raised above the tiles after repaint. (Hope this doesn't add a regression or two xD)

data.title: Fix for #4014
data.body:
Changed from 3 to 2 chars lower limit to trigger search.

No tangible impact on performance, as far as I can see.
